channel.title: Parth Parikh's Blog
channel.description: Explore the exciting world of Computer Science with me! From the depths of Data Structures and Algorithms to the cutting-edge advancements in NLP and Databases, my blog delves into a wide range of topics to keep you informed and inspired.

item.title: Before advanced-flight simulators, there was Navitrainer
item.description: In this blog post, we will delve into the history of another poster that I recently bought. We will explore the Navitrainer, a precursor to advanced flight simulators. We will investigate its origins, how it works, how it was used, and its crucial role in teaching techniques like dead reckoning to trainee pilots.

item.title: Before Xerox, there was Addressograph
item.description: In this article, we will delve into the history of a poster that I recently bought. Our journey will lead us into the fascinating world of the Addressograph - an early addressing machine, invented by Joseph Smith Duncan in the year 1892.

item.title: GADDAG
item.description: This article discusses GADDAG, a data structure for efficiently generating moves in Scrabble using a modified directed acyclic word graph.

item.title: Playing Twenty Questions with ChatGPT
item.description: Can you play the Twenty Questions game with ChatGPT? In this article, we will see just how well it can play this classic game.

item.title: What do Kirchhoff, Cayley, and Carroll have in common? And who is Kahrimanian?
item.description: All four individuals made interesting early contributions to a mathematical structure that we now know as a tree. In this article, we will briefly explore their unique contributions and see how the tree structure was introduced in both mathematics and computer science.
